translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Thomaka
The Elder Paṇṇadāyaka’s Birth Story

analyzed: pabbate himavantamhi  vāka cīra dharaḥ aha
translated: “On the Himalayas,🔽I wore garments of bark,
I ate saltless leaves,
and I was restrained in the observances.

analyzed: pāta rāse an uppatte  siddhatthaḥ upagacchi ma
translated: When it was time for the morning meal,🔽the Buddha Siddhattha came to me;
I offered them to the Buddha,
and I was satisfied with my hands.
For ninety-four eons,
the leaf I offered then,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the leaf offering.
For twenty-seven eons,
I was a king with good teeth,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Paṇṇadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā paṇṇadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Paṇṇadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā paṇṇadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽paṇṇadāyaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Elder Paṇṇadāyaka’s Birth Story, the eighth.
